content:
# The latest output indicates that the Stone Furnace is currently in a "WORKING" state, which means it is actively smelting Iron Ore into Iron Plates. 
# However, it is still reporting "NO FUEL," which suggests that while it has sufficient Coal (36 units), it is not recognizing it properly for the smelting process.

# The inventory of the Stone Furnace shows that it has 12 units of Iron Ore and has produced 3 Iron Plates so far. 
# This discrepancy may indicate a need to re-check the setup or fully restart the smelting operation.

# As a corrective measure, I will try inserting another 5 units of Coal into the Stone Furnace to see if that resolves any fuel issues.
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, target=stone_furnace_entity, quantity=5)  # Inserting 5 more units of Coal into the furnace.

# Once again, I will verify the status of the Stone Furnace after this action to ensure it's now operating correctly.
furnace_inventory = inspect_inventory(stone_furnace_entity)  # Inspect the furnace inventory after this insertion.
current_status = stone_furnace_entity.status  # Get the current status of the Stone Furnace.
print(f"Stone Furnace Inventory after adding more Coal: {furnace_inventory}")  # Display the contents of the Stone Furnace.
print(f"Current status of the Stone Furnace after adding Coal: {current_status}")  # Display the current status after adding fuel. 
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Checking the state of entities after this action.
print(f"Inventory changed to {inspect_inventory()}")  # Final check on the inventory.
